div.div: After this chceck in other connection someone may invalidate the table

div.div: Add this point the table is guarded by the DDL triggers, to fix the RACE CODITION we check validity once again

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 353px; height: 1px; padding-top: 210px; margin-left: 636px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #6666FF; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div: The blue operations fix the RACE CODIITION with table validation but are only possible for Postgres ver >= 11 (with stored procedures and subtransactions)

switch.text: The blue operations fix the RACE CODIITION with table valid...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 108px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1040px; margin-left: 741px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 10px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #FF0000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div: When this operation failed the database will stay in invalid state: triggers for invalid tables still present, FATAL

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 481px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1220px; margin-left: 349px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 15px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #FF0000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div: I think we can ignore RACE CONDITION with the table validation, it is a corner case which unlikely to happen. It is better to have a global function that checks the consistency of the whole HIVE FORK subsystem: validation audit which can inform users about the problems. Or we can rely on errors raised by the triggers. A validation audit may be useful for the dev team in case of solving users problems

switch.text: I think we can ignore RACE CONDITION with the table validation,...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 308px; height: 1px; padding-top: 365px; margin-left: 42px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: left; max-height: 386px; overflow: hidden;
display: inline-block; font-size: 15px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

ol.li: create necessary hive subsystem tables: HIVE_OBSERVED_TABLES, HIVE_TRIGGERS
implement DDL trigger to guard observed tables
reimplement current trigger if we want to use separate operations tables for each observed tables (updates optimization)
? unregister table function ?: to allow users to upgrade application with alter his tables
OPTIONAL clear hive subsystem function (drop triggers, saved operations, and other tables)

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 178px; height: 1px; padding-top: 180px; margin-left: 51px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 15px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

a.text: Viewer does not support full SVG 1.1
